channel.description: Recent content in Math on Harry's Blog

item.title: The Four Color Theorem
item.description: At the end of Stanford Math Camp (SUMaC), it’s a tradition that students will give a research presentation on a topology-related topic that they are interested in. This year, I teamed up with Nanxi and Ben, and we tackled the Four Color Theorem. Below is the presentation that we made. #the-canvas { border: 1px solid black; direction: ltr; width: 100%; height: auto; display: none; } #paginator { display: none; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 10px; } #loadingWrapper { display: none; justify-content: center; align-items: center; width: 100%; height: 350px; } #loading { display: inline-block; width: 50px; height: 50px; border: 3px solid #d2d0d0;; border-radius: 50%; border-top-color: #383838; animation: spin 1s ease-in-out infinite; -webkit-animation: spin 1s ease-in-out infinite; } @keyframes spin { to { -webkit-transform: rotate(360deg); } } @-webkit-keyframes spin { to { -webkit-transform: rotate(360deg); } } Previous Next     Page: / window.
